history.content: I'd recommend using the search feature, there are lots of answers to this question/some variant of it. At the undergraduate level, consider EE 120 (not a math class but an important foundational class from what I hear) and Math 185. At the graduate level, there's EE 227BT, EE C227C, Stat 210A + B, EECS 226a, which are all math heavy and relevant to ML

I'm trying to plan my classes, currently I'm in Math 110, 170, 188 and a second year. In interest of ML/AI research, I was thinking of taking Math 104, Math 128A, (I heard Math 113 is not too useful for ML, might be wrong), EE126/Stat140 (probably EE126), obviously EE127,CS189, but are there any other specialized courses I haven't already listed that I can include here? 

I will take EE127, a math class, and probably CS161/CS 168 upper div next semester.
history.subject: Math Classes for CS ML/AI Research Path
